intro: Canthium mite, commonly known as the African starling, is a small, non-native plant species originally from Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and produces small, white, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It has been introduced to various parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
